oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Indoor Air Quality and Biological Impacts on the Workplace in Housing Systems for Fattening pigs
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hartung, E.
Ollesch, K.
Häussermann, A.
Rieger, M.A.
Diefenbach, H.
Sundrum, A.
Ebke, M.
Lohmeyer, M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Pigs
Health and welfare
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this research of a variety of housing systems for fattening pigs, the impact by microorganisms and their metabolic products, as well as the effects of dust and harmful gases, was central. No distinct differences between the housing systems could be determined regarding the dust and gas concentrations. The biological hazards as well as the impact on animal health varies between the different housing systems.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Hartung, E.; Ollesch, K.; Häussermann, A.; Rieger, M.A.; Diefenbach, H.; Sundrum, A.; Ebke, M. and Lohmeyer, M. (2004) Indoor Air Quality and Biological Impacts on the Workplace in Housing Systems for Fattening pigs. Landtechnik, 59 (10), pp. 220-221.
